input_value.info: Text to be passed as input.
input_value.name: input_value
input_value.value:
Generate a single-page portfolio website using HTML and CSS that takes a resume in JSON format as input and dynamically renders the following sections with a well-structured and aesthetic layout:

📌 Sections & Content Requirements:
	1.	Header:
	•	Display the person’s name, job title, and a professional tagline prominently.
	•	Ensure the name is bold and eye-catching, with subtle emphasis on the job title.
	2.	About Me:
	•	Extract and enhance the personal summary from the resume, making it engaging, concise, and readable.
	•	Use short, well-structured sentences to improve clarity.
	3.	Experience:
	•	List past job roles with company names, durations, and a refined description of responsibilities.
	•	Ensure descriptions are professionally formatted, with key contributions highlighted.
	4.	Projects:
	•	Display projects as a neatly styled list.
	•	Each project includes a title, refined description, technologies used, and rounded buttons linking to GitHub or live demo (if available).
	5.	Skills:
	•	Display skills as aesthetic pill-style badges below the Skills section title. Display all skills mentioned
	•	Arrange in a well-balanced, ensuring readability and consistent spacing.
	6.	Education:
	•	List degrees, institutions, and years attended in a clean and professional format.
	•	Maintain uniformity in typography and spacing.
	7.	Awards & Publications  (if any):
	•	If the resume contains awards or publications, display them in a separate section.
	•	Each entry includes the title, organization, and year, ensuring clean alignment.
	8.	Contact:
	•	Display email, social media links, and an optional contact button.
	•	Ensure social media links are clearly visible, with modern and accessible icon buttons.

🎨 Styling & Aesthetic Requirements:

✅ Minimalist & Elegant:
	•	Clean layout with ample whitespace for breathing room.
	•	Consistent spacing across all sections.

✅ Fast & Lightweight:
	•	Use only HTML & CSS (no JavaScript required).
	•	Ensure a smooth, fast-loading experience.

✅ Beautiful Typography:
	•	Use a modern, professional Google Font that complements the design.
	•	Ensure text readability with proper size, weight, and contrast.

✅ Visually Harmonious Colors & Themes:
	•	Follow a cohesive color palette that ensures a modern, professional feel.
	•	Ensure background colors, text colors, and section dividers are consistent and complementary.
	•	Avoid hard-to-read combinations (e.g., light text on a light background).

✅ Responsive & Readable Design:
	•	Mobile-first approach, adapting to desktop, tablet, and mobile views.
	•	Maintain consistency in padding, margins, and alignment.

✅ Dark Mode Support:
	•	Auto-detect system settings and adjust the theme accordingly.
	•	Ensure clear contrasts and readability in both light and dark modes.

✅ Embedded CSS:
	•	Ensure CSS is written directly in the HTML file within <style> tags for easy integration.

🚀 Key Enhancements for a Superior First Impression:
	•	Ensure the color scheme is visually cohesive and all text is legible against the background.
	•	Maintain uniform padding and spacing for a professional, structured appearance.
	•	Improve text formatting, ensuring sections are balanced and visually engaging.
	•	Follow aesthetically pleasing, simple yet modern design principles.

🌟 End Goal:

The final output should be a well-balanced, visually stunning, and highly readable portfolio website that immediately impresses viewers. The design must be polished, with an intuitive layout, ensuring consistency, clarity, and elegance.
Ensuring all details in resume are well displayed in portfolio website.
Include all experiences, projects and education details from resume in the html code generated.

node.description: Display a chat message in the Playground.

clean_data.info: Whether to clean data before converting to string.
clean_data.name: clean_data

context_id.info: The context ID of the chat. Adds an extra layer to the local memory.
context_id.name: context_id

data_template.info: Template to convert Data to Text. If left empty, it will be dynamically set to the Data's text key.
data_template.name: data_template

input_value.info: Message to be passed as output.
input_value.name: input_value

session_id.info: The session ID of the chat. If empty, the current session ID parameter will be used.
session_id.name: session_id

should_store_message.info: Store the message in the history.
should_store_message.name: should_store_message

node.description:
## 📝 Portfolio Website Code Generator

Your uploaded resume is parsed into a structured format, and output as HTML/CSS code for your own resume website!

✅ **Accepted Formats:** PDF or TXT  
✅ To ensure readability, provide clear headings, bullet points, and proper formatting. 
### 📌 Structured output fields:
1. 🏷 **Full Name** - Candidate's full name  
2. 📧 **Email** - A valid email address  
3. 📞 **Phone Number** - Contact number  
4. 🔗 **LinkedIn** - LinkedIn profile URL  
5. 🖥 **GitHub** - GitHub profile URL (if applicable)  
6. 🌐 **Portfolio** - Personal website or portfolio URL  
7. 🛂 **Visa Status** - Work authorization details (if applicable)  
8. 📝 **Summary** - A brief professional summary or objective statement  
9. 💼 **Experience** - Work experience details (in dictionary format)  
10. 🎓 **Education** - Education details (in dictionary format)  
11. 🛠 **Skills** - Skills mentioned in the resume (comma-separated)  
12. 🚀 **Projects** - Titles, descriptions, and details of projects.
### 💡 Click **Open table** to view the schema
### 💡 Add your OpenAI API key here
### 💡 Add your Anthropic API key here
Format a DataFrame or Data object into text using a template. Enable 'Stringify' to convert input into a readable string instead.

input_data.info: Accepts either a DataFrame or a Data object.
input_data.name: input_data

mode.info: Convert into raw string instead of using a template.
mode.name: mode

pattern.info: Use variables within curly brackets to extract column values for DataFrames or key values for Data.For example: `Name: {Name}, Age: {Age}, Country: {Country}`
pattern.name: pattern

node.description: Loads and returns the content from uploaded files.

advanced_mode.info: Enable advanced document processing and export with Docling for PDFs, images, and office documents. Note that advanced document processing can consume significant resources.
advanced_mode.name: advanced_mode

bucket_name.info: Enter the name of the S3 bucket.
bucket_name.name: bucket_name

concurrency_multithreading.info: When multiple files are being processed, the number of files to process concurrently.
concurrency_multithreading.name: concurrency_multithreading

delete_server_file_after_processing.info: If true, the Server File Path will be deleted after processing.
delete_server_file_after_processing.name: delete_server_file_after_processing

doc_key.info: The key to use for the DoclingDocument column.
doc_key.name: doc_key

file_id.info: The Google Drive file ID to read. The file must be shared with the service account email.
file_id.name: file_id

file_path.info: Data object with a 'file_path' property pointing to server file or a Message object with a path to the file. Supercedes 'Path' but supports same file types.
file_path.name: file_path

file_path_str.info: Path to the file to read. Used when component is called as a tool. If not provided, will use the uploaded file from 'path' input.
file_path_str.name: file_path_str

ignore_unspecified_files.info: If true, Data with no 'file_path' property will be ignored.
ignore_unspecified_files.name: ignore_unspecified_files

ignore_unsupported_extensions.info: If true, files with unsupported extensions will not be processed.
ignore_unsupported_extensions.name: ignore_unsupported_extensions

markdown.info: Export processed documents to Markdown format. Only available when advanced mode is enabled.
markdown.name: markdown

md_image_placeholder.info: Specify the image placeholder for markdown exports.
md_image_placeholder.name: md_image_placeholder

md_page_break_placeholder.info: Add this placeholder between pages in the markdown output.
md_page_break_placeholder.name: md_page_break_placeholder

ocr_engine.info: OCR engine to use. Only available when pipeline is set to 'standard'.
ocr_engine.name: ocr_engine

path.info: Supported file extensions: csv, json, pdf, txt, md, mdx, yaml, yml, xml, html, htm, docx, py, sh, sql, js, ts, tsx, adoc, asciidoc, asc, bmp, dotx, dotm, docm, jpg, jpeg, png, potx, ppsx, pptm, potm, ppsm, pptx, tiff, xls, xlsx, xhtml, webp; optionally bundled in file extensions: zip, tar, tgz, bz2, gz
path.name: path

s3_file_key.info: The key (path) of the file in S3 bucket.
s3_file_key.name: s3_file_key

separator.info: Specify the separator to use between multiple outputs in Message format.
separator.name: separator

service_account_key.info: Your Google Cloud Platform service account JSON key as a secret string (complete JSON content).
service_account_key.name: service_account_key

silent_errors.info: If true, errors will not raise an exception.
silent_errors.name: silent_errors

storage_location.info: Choose where to read the file from.
storage_location.name: storage_location

use_multithreading.info: Set 'Processing Concurrency' greater than 1 to enable multithreading.
use_multithreading.name: use_multithreading

node.description: Runs a language model given a specified provider.

base_url_ibm_watsonx.info: The base URL of the API (IBM watsonx.ai only)
base_url_ibm_watsonx.name: base_url_ibm_watsonx

input_value.info: The input text to send to the model
input_value.name: input_value

ollama_base_url.info: Endpoint of the Ollama API (Ollama only). Defaults to http://localhost:11434
ollama_base_url.name: ollama_base_url

project_id.info: The project ID associated with the foundation model (IBM watsonx.ai only)
project_id.name: project_id

system_message.info: A system message that helps set the behavior of the assistant
system_message.name: system_message

node.description: ### 💡 Add your OpenAI API key here
Uses an LLM to generate structured data. Ideal for extraction and consistency.

input_value.info: The input message to the language model.
input_value.name: input_value

output_schema.info: Define the structure and data types for the model's output.
output_schema.name: output_schema

table_schema.description: Specify the name of the output field.
table_schema.name: name

table_schema.description: Describe the purpose of the output field.
table_schema.name: description

table_schema.description: Indicate the data type of the output field (e.g., str, int, float, bool, dict).
table_schema.name: type

table_schema.description: Set to True if this output field should be a list of the specified type.
table_schema.name: multiple

value.description: Short professional summary or objective statement
value.name: summary

value.description:
Dictionaries of experience details with following keys:
    "job_title": Job position/title,
	"company_name": Employer or organization
	"location": Job location (remote/in-office)
	"start_date": Start date (YYYY-MM)
	"end_date": End date or "Present"
	"responsibilities": List of responsibilities and tasks
	"achievements": List of key achievements and contributions
value.name: experience

value.description:
Dictionaries of Education details with following keys:
"degree": Degree obtained (e.g., B.Sc., M.Sc., Ph.D.),
"field_of_study": Major or specialization,
"institution": University/college name,
"location": Location of institution,
"start_date": Start date (YYYY-MM),
"end_date": Graduation/completion date (YYYY-MM),
"gpa": GPA/grade (if available),
"relevant_courses": List of relevant coursework (if applicable)
value.name: education

value.description: Skills mentioned in the resume. Comma separated.
value.name: skills

value.description: Title and description and details of the project. Including the skills and technologies used.
value.name: projects

schema_name.info: Provide a name for the output data schema.
schema_name.name: schema_name

system_prompt.info: The instructions to the language model for formatting the output.
system_prompt.name: system_prompt
system_prompt.value: You are an AI that extracts structured JSON objects from unstructured text. Use a predefined schema with expected types (str, int, float, bool, dict). Extract ALL relevant instances that match the schema - if multiple patterns exist, capture them all. Fill missing or ambiguous values with defaults: null for missing values. Remove exact duplicates but keep variations that have different field values. Always return valid JSON in the expected format, never throw errors. If multiple objects can be extracted, return them all in the structured format.

description: This template transforms PDF or TXT resume documents into structured JSON, generating a portfolio website HTML code from the structured data.
name: Portfolio Website Code Generator
